      • shouldCensor

        public static boolean shouldCensor(java.lang.String input)
        Informs a Servlet if it should accept a user's post.
        Parameters:
        input - A String from the user.
        Returns:
        true if a censored word is detected, false otherwise.

      • full

        public static java.lang.String full(java.lang.String input)
        Prepares raw Strings from the user for displaying on a web page
        Parameters:
        input - Main String from user
        Returns:
        A fully formatted String that is ready to appear as a post.

      • swapEscapeForHTML

        public static java.lang.String swapEscapeForHTML(java.lang.String input,
                                                 char target,
                                                 java.lang.String replacement,
                                                 int consecutiveLimit)
        Allows special characters from forms to be rendered as HTML.
        Parameters:
        input - Main String from user
        target - Escape character to replace with HTML code
        replacement - HTML code that will replace target
        consecutiveLimit - Maximum times the target may appear consecutively and be replaced. Excess appearances are removed.
        Returns:
        A String which contains ready-made HTML instead of inconsequential Java escape characters.

      • removeRepeats

        public static java.lang.String removeRepeats(java.lang.String input,
                                             java.lang.String target,
                                             int limit)
        Removes consecutive repeats of a String after the amount of repeats surpasses a limit.
        Parameters:
        input - A String from the user, which may have repeats.
        target - The String whose repetitions should be limited.
        limit - Amount of times the target is allowed to repeat
        Returns:
        A String with a limited amount of a repeated target.

        Adds HTML newlines according to the appearance of `n`
        Parameters:
        input - A String from the user with formatting.
        Returns:
        A String with
        instead of `n`

      • addFormat

        private static java.lang.String addFormat(java.lang.String input,
                                          java.lang.String formatClass,
                                          char trigger)
        Replace a backtick format marker, such as `b`, with its respective span class
        Parameters:
        input - A String from the user with formatting markers.
        formatClass - The CSS class of the formatting type.
        trigger - The character that will be used inside of the backticks to form the marker.
        Returns:
        A String whose markers have been replaced with spans.

      • addLinks

        private static java.lang.String addLinks(java.lang.String input)
        Makes text surrounded with tildes (~) clickable. These clickable links will open in new tabs.
        Parameters:
        input - A String fro the user.
        Returns:
        A String with clickable links; determined by user.

      • clean

        private static java.lang.String clean(java.lang.String input)
        Strip potentially dangerous characters to prevent HTML injection.
        Parameters:
        input - A String from the user.
        Returns:
        A String without angle brackets representations.
